text:
I have put a couple of potential project ideas up for Google Season of Docs 2024: <https://github.com/rstats-gsod/gsod2024/wiki/table-of-project-ideas>.

These have been discussed with members of the CRAN Team and do have some support, but are still quite tentative at the moment. If you are interested to get involved as a technical writer or mentor on either project, it would be good to know, along with the skills/experience you could bring to the project. Volunteer mentors can be budgeted in for a $500 stipend (which can also be waived and donated e.g. to the R Foundation/R-Ladies or similar). There is also potential to budget in a senior writer/project manager for someone more heavily involved.

If you are interested to get involved as a technical writer or mentor on either project, it would be good to know, along with the skills/experience you could bring to the project. Volunteer mentors can be budgeted in for a $500 stipend (which can also be waived and donated e.g. to the R Foundation/R-Ladies or similar). There is also potential to budget in a senior writer/project manager for someone more heavily involved.

text:
These projects look great and I'd love to get involved as a technical writer or mentor, particularly with the *Cookbook style documentation for CRAN maintainers*.

I have some relevant recent experience from this past Fall when I needed to make a very minor change to {shinyLP} and ran into a _host_ of other issues that were challenging to sort out - I'd love to make this process smoother for future :package: maintainers
